title: Preparing Data
text: examples within HASP given data obtained via dataRetrieval functions. article describes use external (non-dataRetrieval) data HASP functions. Users can import data R favorite ways, use data frames scripted work flows. 3 main data types used HASP package: daily data (argument = gw_level_dv), field groundwater levels (argument = gwl), water quality data (argument = qw_data). HASP package provides sample data named L2701_example_data. data also provided , simplified Microsoft™ Excel file: use readxl package import data examples. main idea import data, figure columns need, call functions appropriately.
code: library(HASP) system.file("extdata", "sample.xlsx", package = "HASP")

title: Preparing Data
text: import sample file. can done number ways. point get 3 data frames R environment.
code: sample_data_path <- system.file("extdata", "sample.xlsx",                                 package = "HASP") daily_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(path = sample_data_path,                                  sheet = "Daily") names(daily_data) ## [1] "Date"   "Value"  "Remark" gwl_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(path = sample_data_path,                                  sheet = "Field") names(gwl_data) ## [1] "Date"   "Value"  "Remark" qw_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(path = sample_data_path,                                  sheet = "QW")  names(qw_data) ## [1] "Date"      "Value"     "Remark"    "parameter"

title: Preparing Data
text: water-quality plots less flexible, require data frame column names “sample_dt”, “parm_cd”, “result_va”, “remark_cd”. Renaming columns R can done several ways, one using dplyr’s rename function:
code: monthly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv = daily_data,                        gwl_data = NULL,                        date_col = "Date",                        value_col = "Value",                        approved_col = "Remark",                        plot_title = "External Data") gwl_plot_all(gw_level_dv = daily_data,              gwl_data =  gwl_data,               date_col = c("Date", "Date"),              value_col = c("Value", "Value"),              approved_col = c("Remark", "Remark"),              plot_title = "External Data",               add_trend = TRUE) library(dplyr)  qw_data <- qw_data %>%    rename(ActivityStartDateTime = Date,           ResultMeasureValue = Value) %>%     mutate(CharacteristicName = case_when(parameter %in%                                            c("99220", "00940") ~ "Chloride",                                         parameter %in%                                            c("90095", "00095") ~ "Specific conductance"))  Sc_Cl_plot(qw_data = qw_data,             "External Data") trend_plot(qw_data,             plot_title = "External Data")

title: Single Site Data Availability
text: Using dataRetrieval code get data site:
code: library(dataRetrieval) siteID <- "263819081585801" parameterCd <- "62610" statCd <- "00001" # Daily data: gw_level_dv <- readNWISdv(siteID,                           parameterCd,                           statCd = statCd)  # Field measured: gwl_data <- readNWISgwl(siteID)  # Water quality data: cl_sc <- c("Chloride", "Specific conductance") qw_data <- readWQPqw(siteNumbers = paste0("USGS-", siteID),                      parameterCd = cl_sc)  plot_title <- "L -2701\n263819081585801" y_label <- dataRetrieval::readNWISpCode(parameterCd)$parameter_nm

title: Hydrologic AnalySis Package
text: Hydrologic AnalySis Package Hydrologic Analysis Package (HASP) can retrieve groundwater level groundwater quality data, aggregate data, plot , generate basic statistics. One benefits HASP ability aggregate two time-series data one record generate statistics graphics record. merging two data sets together, users can view manipulate much longer record data. Users can download aggregated record see basic statistics calculated data. HASP also allows users plot groundwater level trends major aquifers well. explore_aquifers function allows users pull data wells classified Principal Aquifers synthesize water-level data better understand trends. Inspiration: https://fl.water.usgs.gov/mapper/ See https://rconnect.usgs.gov/HASP_docs/ information!

title: Hydrologic AnalySis Package
code: library(HASP) library(dataRetrieval) site <- "263819081585801"  #Field GWL data: gwl_data <- dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl(site)  # Daily data: parameterCd <- "62610" statCd <- "00001" dv <- dataRetrieval::readNWISdv(site,                                 parameterCd,                                 statCd = statCd)  # Water Quality data: parameterCd <- c("00095","90095","00940","99220") qw_data <- dataRetrieval::readWQPqw(paste0("USGS-", site),                                     parameterCd) y_axis_label <- dataRetrieval::readNWISpCode("62610")$parameter_nm  monthly_frequency_plot(dv,                        parameter_cd = "62610",                        plot_title = "L2701_example_data",                        y_axis_label = y_axis_label) gwl_plot_all(gw_level_dv = dv,               gwl_data = gwl_data,               parameter_cd = "62610",              plot_title = "L2701_example_data",               add_trend = TRUE, flip_y = FALSE) Sc_Cl_plot(qw_data, "L2701_example_data") trend_plot(qw_data, plot_title = "L2701_example_data")

text: Function create field groundwater level data plot.

title: Single site groundwater level plots and tables — gwl_plot_field
code: gwl_plot_field(   gwl_data,   plot_title = "",   parameter_cd = NA,   date_col = "lev_dt",   value_col = NA,   approved_col = "lev_age_cd",   flip = TRUE,   y_label = "" )  gwl_plot_all(   gw_level_dv,   gwl_data,   parameter_cd = NA,   date_col = NA,   value_col = NA,   approved_col = NA,   stat_cd = NA,   y_label = "GWL",   plot_title = "",   add_trend = FALSE,   flip = FALSE )

title: Single site groundwater level plots and tables — gwl_plot_field
text: gwl_data data frame returned dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl,  data frame mandatory columns lev_dt (representing date), lev_age_cd (representing approval code), column representing measured value (either lev_va, sl_lev_va, value). plot_title character parameter_cd Parameter code filtered column specifically named "parameter_cd". data come directly NWIS services,  can set NA,argument ignored. date_col name date column. Default "lev_dt". value_col name value column. NA, code attempt autogenerate based parameter_cd approved_col name approval column. Default "lev_age_cd". flip logical. TRUE, flips y axis smallest number top. Default TRUE. y_label character y-axis label. Consider using readNWISpCode USGS parameter_nm. gw_level_dv daily value groundwater levels. Must include columns specified date_col, value_col, approved_col. stat_cd data gw_level_dv comes NWIS, stat_cd  can used help define value_col. add_trend logical. Uses kendell_test_5_20_years.

title: Single site groundwater level plots and tables — gwl_plot_field
code: # site <- "263819081585801" # gwl_data <- dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl(site)  # Using package example data: gwl_data <- L2701_example_data$Discrete plot_title <- attr(gwl_data, "siteInfo")[["station_nm"]] pcodes <- dataRetrieval::readNWISpCode(unique(gwl_data$parameter_cd)) gwl_plot_field(gwl_data,                 plot_title = paste(plot_title,                                   pcodes$parameter_nm[pcodes$parameter_cd == "62610"]),                 parameter_cd = "62610",                flip = FALSE)  gwl_plot_field(gwl_data,  paste(plot_title,                pcodes$parameter_nm[pcodes$parameter_cd == "62611"]),                 parameter_cd = "62611",                flip = FALSE)  gwl_plot_field(gwl_data,  paste(plot_title,                          pcodes$parameter_nm[pcodes$parameter_cd == "72019"]),                 parameter_cd = "72019")  # site <- "263819081585801" parameterCd <- "62610" # statCd <- "00001" # gw_level_dv <- dataRetrieval::readNWISdv(site, parameterCd, statCd = statCd) # Using package example data: gw_level_dv <- L2701_example_data$Daily gwl_data <- L2701_example_data$Discrete plot_title <- attr(gwl_data, "siteInfo")[["station_nm"]] pcodes <- dataRetrieval::readNWISpCode(unique(gwl_data$parameter_cd))  gwl_plot_all(gw_level_dv,               NULL,               parameter_cd = "62610",              plot_title = plot_title,              flip = FALSE)    gwl_plot_all(gw_level_dv,               gwl_data,               parameter_cd = "62610",              plot_title = paste(plot_title,                          pcodes$parameter_nm[pcodes$parameter_cd == "62610"]),              add_trend = TRUE)                gwl_plot_all(NULL,               gwl_data,               parameter_cd = "62610",              plot_title = paste(plot_title,                          pcodes$parameter_nm[pcodes$parameter_cd == "62610"]))

title: Seasonal Kendall Trend Test — kendell_test_5_20_years

code: kendell_test_5_20_years(   gwl,   parameter_cd_gwl = NA,   date_col = "lev_dt",   value_col = "sl_lev_va",   alpha = 0.95,   seasonal = TRUE,   enough_5 = 10,   enough_20 = 6,   include_current_year = FALSE )

title: Seasonal Kendall Trend Test — kendell_test_5_20_years
text: gwl data frame must include numeric column defined "value_col", Date POSIXct column defined "date_col" parameter_cd_gwl Parameter code filtered column specifically named "parameter_cd". data come directly NWIS services,  can set NA,argument ignored. date_col name date column. value_col name value column. alpha confidence level use statistical significance seasonal logical. Use seasonal kendall test seasonal. Default TRUE. enough_5 number per year. Default 10. enough_20 number per year. Default 6. include_current_year logical indicating whether include data current calendar year test.

title: Seasonal Kendall Trend Test — kendell_test_5_20_years
text: data frame test results 5 20 year Kendall Seasonal Trend test

title: Plot monthly frequency analysis — monthly_frequency_plot
code: monthly_frequency_plot(   gw_level_dv,   gwl_data,   parameter_cd = NA,   date_col = NA,   value_col = NA,   approved_col = NA,   stat_cd = NA,   plot_title = "",   subtitle = "U.S. Geological Survey",   plot_range = c("Past year"),   y_axis_label = "",   flip = FALSE )

title: Plot monthly frequency analysis — monthly_frequency_plot
text: gw_level_dv data frame, daily groundwater level data. Often obtained readNWISdv gwl_data data frame returned dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl,  data frame mandatory columns lev_dt (representing date), lev_age_cd (representing approval code), column representing measured value (either lev_va, sl_lev_va, value). parameter_cd data gw_level_dv comes NWIS, parameter_cd  can used define value_col.  data come directly NWIS services,  can set NA,argument ignored. date_col heading date column. default NA, code try get column name automatically. value_col name value column. default NA, code try get column name automatically. approved_col name column get provisional/approved status. stat_cd data gw_level_dv comes NWIS, stat_cd  can used help define value_col. plot_title title use plot. subtitle character. Sub-title plot, default "U.S. Geological Survey". plot_range time frame use plot. Either "Past year" use last year data, "Calendar year" use current calendar year, beginning January. y_axis_label label used y-axis plot. flip logical. TRUE, flips y axis smallest number top. Default TRUE.

title: Plot monthly frequency analysis — monthly_frequency_plot
text: ggplot rectangles representing historical monthly percentile, black triangles representing historical monthly median, red diamonds showing last year groundwater level measurements.

title: Plot monthly frequency analysis — monthly_frequency_plot
code: # site <- "263819081585801" p_code_dv <- "62610" statCd <- "00001" # gw_level_dv <- dataRetrieval::readNWISdv(site, p_code_dv, statCd = statCd) gw_level_dv <- L2701_example_data$Daily label <- dataRetrieval::readNWISpCode(p_code_dv)[["parameter_nm"]] monthly_frequency <- monthly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                                             gwl_data = NULL,                                             parameter_cd = "62610",                                             plot_title = "L2701 Groundwater Level",                                             y_axis_label = label,                                             flip = FALSE) monthly_frequency   gwl_data <- L2701_example_data$Discrete  monthly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                        gwl_data = gwl_data,                        parameter_cd = "62610",                        plot_title = "L2701 Groundwater Level",                        y_axis_label = label,                        flip = FALSE)   monthly_frequency_flip <- monthly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                                                  gwl_data,                                                  parameter_cd = "62610",                                                  y_axis_label = label,                                                  plot_title = "L2701 Groundwater Level",                                                   flip = TRUE) monthly_frequency_flip

title: ggplot2 themes and accesories for package — theme_gwl
text: Themes useful graphing utilities HASP package

title: ggplot2 themes and accesories for package — theme_gwl
code: theme_gwl(base_family = "", ...)  hasp_framework(   x_label,   y_label,   plot_title,   include_y_scale = FALSE,   zero_on_top = TRUE,   subtitle = "U.S. Geological Survey" )

title: ggplot2 themes and accesories for package — theme_gwl
text: base_family character base font family ... additional arguments x_label character. Label x-axis. y_label character. Label y-axis. plot_title character. Title plot. include_y_scale logical. TRUE, include groundwater type style y-axis. Default FALSE. zero_on_top logical. zero_on_top TRUE, padding top y axis. FALSE, padding bottom. NA, padding top bottom. subtitle character. Sub-title plot, default "U.S. Geological Survey".

title: ggplot2 themes and accesories for package — theme_gwl
code: ggplot2::ggplot() + theme_gwl()     x_label <- "Date" y_label <- "Level" plot_title <- "Super Site"  ggplot2::ggplot() +       hasp_framework(x_label,                      y_label,                      plot_title)

title: Plot weekly frequency analysis — weekly_frequency_plot
code: weekly_frequency_plot(   gw_level_dv,   gwl_data,   parameter_cd = NA,   date_col = NA,   value_col = NA,   approved_col = NA,   stat_cd = NA,   plot_range = "Past year",   plot_title = "",   subtitle = "U.S. Geological Survey",   y_axis_label = "",   flip = FALSE )

title: Plot weekly frequency analysis — weekly_frequency_plot
text: gw_level_dv data frame, daily groundwater level data. Often obtained readNWISdv. gwl_data data frame returned dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl,  data frame mandatory columns lev_dt (representing date), lev_age_cd (representing approval code), column representing measured value (either lev_va, sl_lev_va, value). parameter_cd data gw_level_dv comes NWIS, parameter_cd  can used define value_col.  data come directly NWIS services,  can set NA,argument ignored. date_col heading date column. default NA, code try get column name automatically. value_col name value column. default NA, code try get column name automatically. approved_col name column get provisional/approved status. stat_cd data gw_level_dv comes NWIS, stat_cd  can used help define value_col. plot_range time frame use plot. Either "Past year" use last year data, "Calendar year" use current calendar year, beginning January. plot_title title use plot subtitle character. Sub-title plot, default "U.S. Geological Survey". y_axis_label label used y-axis plot. flip logical. TRUE, flips y axis smallest number top. Default FALSE.

title: Plot weekly frequency analysis — weekly_frequency_plot
text: ggplot object rectangles representing historical weekly percentiles, points representing historical median daily values

title: Plot weekly frequency analysis — weekly_frequency_plot
code: # site <- "263819081585801" p_code_dv <- "62610" statCd <- "00001" # gw_level_dv <- dataRetrieval::readNWISdv(site, p_code_dv, statCd = statCd) gw_level_dv <- L2701_example_data$Daily weekly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                        gwl_data = NULL,                       date_col = "Date",                       value_col = "X_62610_00001",                       approved_col = "X_62610_00001_cd") #> Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values (geom_rect). #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_point).                         gwl_data <- L2701_example_data$Discrete  weekly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                        gwl_data = gwl_data,                       parameter_cd = "62610") #> Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values (geom_rect). #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_point).                         weekly_frequency_plot(gw_level_dv,                        gwl_data = gwl_data,                       parameter_cd = "62610",                        flip = TRUE) #> Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values (geom_rect). #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_point).
